title: Steve Bruce denies Joelinton is a £40m Newcastle United flop despite unimpressive start in Premier League
text:
Steve Bruce has denied Brazilian striker Joelinton is a £40 million flop even though he has managed just one goal for Newcastle United since his summer move from Hoffenheim.

Joelinton is struggling as he tries to find his feet in English football, a process hindered by the fact Newcastle are one of the bluntest attacking forces in the Premier League.

The lack of goals is a major worry for Bruce, who has had to focus on tightening things up at the back since the 5-0 thrashing at Leicester City. That shift to a five-man defence has yielded a 1-0 win over Manchester United and a defeat by the same scoreline at Chelsea last weekend, but Bruce knows it has left the team lacking a goal threat.

“Every goalscorer needs a bit of service, and that’s the difficult part of the game,” said Bruce, whose side take on Wolverhampton Wanderers on Sunday. “We have to try to get that.

“We got ourselves into good positions at Chelsea and nothing came of it. We’ve got to make better decisions and be more clinical. The decisions we made last week weren’t good enough.
description: Steve Bruce has denied Brazilian striker Joelinton is a £40 million flop even though he has managed just one goal for Newcastle United since his summer move from Hoffenheim.
